Constructor Detail

ShortestPath


public ShortestPath(MyVertex[][] vertexArray,

                    HashSet sourceSet,

                    double cellSize,

                    boolean prob)
Implements Dikjstra's shortest path algorithm.

Parameters:
MyVertex[][] - vertexArray:
HashSet - sourceSet:
double - cellSize: the raster resolution in user-defined units. The distance between cell1 and cell2 is calculated as mean(cost1, cost2)*cellSize. Thus a value >1 should only be used if cost1, cost1 represent absolute costs such as fuel price or energy expenditure. If cost1, cost2 are relative costs, cellSize should be set to 1.
boolean - prob: true if all multiple paths are returned (stochastic version of the shortest path), false if only one path is returned.
Method Detail

execute


public void execute()

public double getPathCost()
Calculates the cumulative cost of the path.

Returns:
double path cost.

getPathLength


public double getPathLength()
Calculates the number of vertices in the path.

double path length: the number of vertices in the path.

getPredecessor


public MyVertex getPredecessor(MyVertex v)
Identifies the predecessor vertex in the ShortestPath.

Parameters:
MyVertex - v: the vertex whose predecessor we want to know.
Returns:
MyVertex the predecessor vertex.

getShortestDistance


public double getShortestDistance(MyVertex vertex)
Computes the shortest distance from source for a given vertex.

Parameters:
MyVertex - vertex: the vertex to which the shortest path is to be computed.
Returns:
double distance: the distance between the vertex and the source. If cellSize==1 these are relative distance values, if cellSize!=1 these are absolute values (e.g. fuel cost). Returns null if the vertex is not in the path.

getShortestPathVertices


public HashSet getShortestPathVertices()
Returns the list of vertices in the ShortestPath.

Returns:
HashSet shortestPathVertices: a set containing all vertices in the path.

main


public static void main(String[] args)

                 throws IOException
Produces a random raster and computes the cumulative cost raster that can be compared with results from ArcGIS.

Parameters:
String - args[0] is the name of the output ascii random raster.
String - args[1] is the name of the output ascii cumulative cost raster. The graph is output to the screen for debugging. The raster is small (8x8) to facilitate debugging.
Throws:
IOException
